Key Match Events: Wales' Euro 2024 qualification hopes were ended in a penalty shootout 5-4 against Poland following a goalless draw.
Daniel James' penalty was saved in the bottom left corner, leading to Poland's victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales manager reflected on the Euro 2024 qualifying exit, describing it as 'a horrible way to go out'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at Cardiff City Stadium with an attendance of 31,876.
The match ended with a possession of 42.3% for Wales and 57.7% for Poland.
Wales had 4 shots on goal while Poland had none.
The match was officiated by referee Daniele Orsato.
